info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 28 at 3:17PM CDT by NWS Corpus Christi
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Goliad, western Refugio and east central Bee Counties through 400 PM CDT... At 317 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles south of Fannin, or 13 miles west of McFaddin, moving southwest at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Refugio, Woodsboro, Bonnie View and Blanconia. This includes the following highways... US Highway 183 between mile markers 650 and 668. US Highway 77 between mile markers 610 and 632. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
